fields.description:
While deploying on JBoss:

   Specification violation [EJB3 JPA 6.2.1.2] - You have not defined a jta-data-source for a JTA enabled persistence context named: propertyset

http://ondra.zizka.cz/stranky/programovani/java/misc/jira-on-jboss-specification-violation-EJB3-JPA-jta-data-source-persistence-context-propertyset.texy

Are users supposed to explode `jira.war/WEB-INF/lib/propertyset-1.5.jar`, edit it's `/META-INF/persistence.xml`, re-pack and deploy the result? With every Jira upgrade?
fields.summary: propertyset.jar!/WEB-INF/persistence.xml is missing <jta-data-source> definition

fields.description:
In expandoninput.js, the function setHeight scrolls the navigator window so that the bottom of the text box which is resized is visible.

This behavior is nice when a new line is added at the end of a text box, so that the new line becomes visible. However, it is quite disturbing in the following situation:

    * The height of the text box is greater than the height of the current window,
    * The user edits the text at the top of the box: whenever a new line is created, the window is scrolled, and the cursor is no longer visible.

This behavior does not happen so much with the standard installation of JIRA, because the size of text box is limited to a few lines, but it does happen in our configuration, because we like to configure text box so that they extend without limit.

This issue was first reported in https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AJS-614
fields.summary: expandOnInput scrolls so that the bottom of the text box is visible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24368].
  {panel}

In statistics gadgets (Issue Statistics and Two Dimensional Filter Statistics), it will only show values if there are actually any issues associated with those values. It will not show possible values if there are zero issues associated. Let's say you have a field called 'Fruit' with 4 possible values : apple, banana, orange, grapes. Those gadgets will currently only show the first 3 rows below, not the last one. We need the last one to show , too. Same goes for columns, in a 2-dimensional gadget.
Fruit 	   Count
Apple 	1
Banana 	5
Orange 	3
Grapes 	0

Please see http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-9626 which was originally opened for this request in JIRA portlets. That request was closed because you no longer have 'portlets' but now you have gadgets. To be honest, we could have just renamed that request.... Anyway, here is the new request.
fields.summary: As a user I would like the option to show zero counts on statistics gadgets (Issue Statistics and Two Dimensional Filter Statistics)

fields.description:
You can toggle the issue view screen to show subtasks + quick create form.  But you can't toggle the issue view screen to show subtasks and hide the quick create form.  It's all-or-nothing.  

Ideally, there's a toggle to hide the quick create form.  In previous JIRA's, the quick create form did not get in the way of the user _until_ they clicked on *Add Subtask*.
fields.summary: I want to see sub-tasks and optionally hide the sub-task quick create form

fields.description:
I would like to re-open that issue. It's a requirement for us

Allow users to have the ability to manage versions without being a project administrator, by adding the proper permission in the permission scheme.

For some users, is valuable to let the engineers create new versions without actually being project administrators.
fields.summary: CLONE - Add the ability to manage versions without being a project administrator

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Go to In LDAP Schema section of Directory Setting
# Insert Value for "Additional User DN" and "Additional Group DN"
# Test and Save the setting
# Edit the directory setting
# Remove both "Additional User DN" and "Additional Group DN" values.
# Test and Save setting
# Reopen the directory setting, Deleted "Additional User DN" and "Additional Group DN" values still exist. 
|

*Workaround*
In edit mode, enter a white space to remove the old values or enter new values for both settings.
fields.summary: Unable to remove "Additional User DN" and "Additonal Group DN" Values

If I try to edit the project and submit by pressing "Update", the following error message is displayed: "You must have the browse project permission to view this project." (please see attachment)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24361].
  {panel}

I'm new to JIRA and GreenHopper, and it would save me a lot of time if I could click on "Help" from any screen in the application, and get context-sensitive help.

Currently, the only Help link is located in the dropdown list menu under my personal name.  (As a separate issue, it seems very unintuitive for me to look for Help under my personal name.  I would more likely expect it to exist as its own always-present menu, help being a pretty important component of a software package).

When I click on "Isaac Gartner -> Help" I'm taken to the homepage of JIRA Help, and I have to navigate to find the particular help I'm looking for.  I would prefer to be taken automatically to the help I'm looking for.

For example, I'm currently trying to learn GreenHopper, and I'm in the Planning Board.  I would like to be able to click on "Help" (the "Help" link would ideally would appear directly on the page, as mentioned above) and be taken directly to a page discussing the Planning Board screen of GreenHopper.
fields.summary: Context-sensitive help

fields.description:
From time to time, we have components that are retired from a project. We would like to be able to "lock" a component to prevent it from being assigned to any additional issues, while retaining it in issues that already have it for historical purposes. This would be similar to archiving a version and would be a very useful feature. Please consider including it in a future release of JIRA.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Locking a component

fields.description:
On the page http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Linking+Issues there is a note that says "To create links between issues, you will need to have the Link Issues permission in the project(s) to which the issues belong." 
This is true, however, you also need linking to be enabled, which can be seen (but I don't think is described) here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Issue+Linking . See the screenshot under "Adding a Link Type" -- you have to go there and activate linking.

Turning on issue linking should be described and linked from the note quoted above (on the Linking Issues page). If how to turn on linking is not explained in detail anywhere, first make that page.
fields.summary: Describe prerequisite of Linking Issues

The problem is, the link from the first page includes an anchor link that no longer exists in the second, titled "Starting JIRA".

fields.description: We use projects in JIRA as major development initiatives.  For this reason a large amount of times the components would be the same across multiple projects.  Right now there is no easy way to do this that I am aware of.  We would like the ability to copy components from one project to another.
fields.summary: Would like the ability to migrate Components between Projects

fields.description:
We use our Fixed Versions as releases.  Our Releases can include items from multiple JIRA projects.  We would like a way to create and manage Fix Versions across multiple projects.  This would cut down on Administration and user error for releases and allow us to do a search for all items in a release without having to write custom queries.

My suggestion is to make Fixed Version like a Group that multiple or single projects can join.  You would need to add a new Permission to the Permission schema for "Create and edit Fix Version" removing this from "Resolved Issue" (These should be seperate anyway)  The Project Role Administrators would be able to join or remove Fixed Versions for that project but would not have the ability to add or delete new Fixed Versions unless they were granted "Create and edit Fix Version"
fields.summary: We would like to assign the same Fixed Version across multiple projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24348].
  {panel}

In the way we've structured JIRA issues we have 'block' links mapping the progression of a project.

For instance:
Planning issue blocks Development issue
Development issue blocks QA issue
QA issue blocks Launch issue

The feature i'm looking for is someway for the assignee of the blocked issue to be notified when the blocking issue is resolved (or closed), so they know they can start work.

Currently I know of no way for the assignee of the blocked issue to get a notification when the blocking issue is resolved (or closed). The only way I know to do this is for the person to watch the issue, but that creates too much information flow, the assignee of the blocked issue just needs to know when they can start working (blocking issue is resolved or closed).

I'm not sure the best way to do this, so I'm open to your suggestions.
If anyone has found workarounds or there are plugins out there, please post those too.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Notifying assignee of linked issue when linked issue is resolved

We use Crowd for external user management. 
Yesterday I removed a user in Crowd that resigned his position. 
At least one issue in Jira was assigned to this user. 

When we try to edit the issue assigned to the no-longer-existing-user, Jira throws server error (see attached file).

I believe Jira should disable the user but not delete it?

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*:
* Add the "Favourite Filters" gadget to the Dashboard.
* Set it to automatically refresh every 15 minutes.
* Make a change to your favourite filters (add or remove one) in another tab, and leave the Dashboard tab open.

*Expected result*:
After 15 minutes the Favourite Filters gadget will refresh and the newly-added filter will show.

*Actual result*:
The Favourite Filters gadget won't update until the entire page is refreshed.

This seems to occur only with the Favourite Filters gadget. Assigned To Me, etc. appear to be refreshing correctly.
fields.summary: Favourite Filters gadget doesn't auto-refresh under IE7

fields.description:
When having an external import, such as Bugzilla, Mantis... the database password with special characters is encoded, and it hasn't decoded when piece together jdbc url, so it always fails to pass database authentication.

An example is to import Bugzilla by db user with password "my$pass", then we will fail by the below error:

Could not connect to 'jdbc:mysql://192.168.129.55/bugzilla?autoReconnect=true&useUnicode=true&zeroDateTimeBehavior=convertToNull&user=bugs&password=my%24pass'
fields.summary: DB password with special character doesn't work for external importing

fields.description:
We have a relatively large JIRA installation with multiple projects. There are project admins for each of the projects and the set of developers per project are explicitly maintained. Every now and then - it happens that one of our project admins assigns jira-users to some of the project roles (usually Developers), which leads to the result that all of our users start getting mail notifications for issues created in the corresponding project. 
I see several ways to solve that and am looking for your guidance on how to resolve the problem:
- assignment of particular groups to particular roles is restricted (somehow - probably a flag per group, whether it's "assignable").
- allow to filter out notifications and send them only to individually assigned users and not to groups (can be a general setting to disable traversal of groups) - will work for our environment

The root cause of the problem is of course the lack of experience of the project admins, however on the contrary - it's quite easy for them to make a mistake and we must protect the system from being so fragile and open for abuse. 

thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Restrict assignment of selected groups to project roles (jira-users in particular)

fields.description:
On IE8, when a user clicks the login/approve button for a gadget, the pop-up window does not resize to display the button at the bottom of the screen and so users will be confused as to what to do with this pop-up window. This issue is only ocurring on IE8

Replication Steps:

1. Create new dashboard.
2. Add gadget. (For example, Confluence Page Gadget)
3. Button will show up in that gadget "Login and Approve"
4. Once clicking it, a new window would normally appear titled "Request for Access"
5. The approve buttons in that window do not appear because the window does not resize itself to show all the content.

Workaround:

Enable [Compatibility Mode|http://support.microsoft.com/kb/956197]
fields.summary: "Request for Access" window not resizable to display buttons after add a gadget using IE8

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 21 December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hello All,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are not currently any plans to implement this suggestion.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Gracias,
Otto Ruettinger
Principal Product Manager, JIRA
oruettinger (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

\\

*Original description*
Similar to CONF-21982 it would be desirable to have the ability to retrieve LDAP properties for users.

We are using JIRA as a help desk system and have attached it to a Windows Active Directory LDAP server with a plug-in (https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/16524). The plug-in implements com.opensymphony.user.provider.CredentialsProvider, is able to authenticate the user, add group memberships and store custom user properties as PropertySet attributes in the JIRA database.

The custom properties are necessary for our support team and are displayed on the user profile and issue screen (ie. for phone dialing without using an external phone book application).

With JIRA 4.3 there is a possiblity to switch to the provided LDAP integration, but there seems to be no way to retrieve additional LDAP properties.

We have also investigated in using a separate Crowd installation and delegating user security to Crowd. It is possible to create user defined user and group properties in Crowd but these properties are not synchronized into the JIRA database.
fields.summary: Ability to retrieve LDAP properties for a JIRA user from external LDAP directory

fields.summary: JIRA is not generating notification for issue deleted event to user/group custom field value

fields.description:
When the "Current Issues" button is clicked in the User Hover "More" menu, it performs the JQL search: 
{{assignee = _user_ AND resolution IS EMPTY}}.

Would it be possible to change this to generate the following instead:
{{assignee = _user_ AND resolution = Unresolved}}

That way the query generated is "simple" and doesn't flip the Issue Navigator into advanced mode, and potentially prevents simple users from getting into something they don't know.
fields.summary: "Current Issues" button on User Hover should generate a simple search instead of advanced one

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms
Go to {{Administration -> System -> Atlassian Support Tools}}. JIRA fails throwing an stack trace on the screen.

The following error appears on {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{code}com.atlassian.templaterenderer.RenderingException: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getApplicationProperties' in class $Proxy584 threw exception java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: This method is not supported in an UnloadableJiraServiceContainer at /templates/system-info.vm[line 1, column 12]{code}

h4. Cause

When JIRA cannot start a service, in this case the *Subversion Revision Indexing Service*, the Atlassian Support Tools throws an *Content Encoding Error*. This is a bug and will be fixed soon.

h4. Resolution
Reinstall the JIRA Subversion Plugin or remove the problematic service through {{Administration -> System -> Plugins}}. If you're upgrading your instance, be aware that the *Subversion Revision Indexing Service* should be automatically created if you have installed Subversion in the old instance, causing this error.
fields.summary: JIRA Subversion Revision Indexing Service prevents Atlassian Support Tools from working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24322].
  {panel}

I would like to see a new feature added to be able to set the default on whether the email is sent or not when a new user is created.  In my instance we have a custom Single Sign On solution where we do not want a user to receive a notification when their JIRA account is created.  A setting in the Administration console under General Administration would be a good spot for it.

Another part of this is that we are specifically using the SOAP services to create users and it would be helpful to have a value that can be set in the API to turn emails on or off when creating that one user.

Thanks,
Justin
fields.summary: Ability to Turn On and Off User Creation Notification

fields.description:
When performing a search using the != operator, issues with a null value in the specified field is not returned.

For example:
Project is Test
Issue1 has label 'bug'
Issue2 has label 'task'
Issue3 does not have a label set.

Running the query:
{code}PROJECT = 'Test' AND LABEL != 'bug'{code}
This only returns Issue2 and not Issue3

Workaround is to use the query:
{code}PROJECT = 'Test' AND (LABEL != 'bug' OR LABEL is empty){code}
fields.summary: The JQL search operator != skips null values

fields.description:
Hi,

In our instance, we modify {{permissions schemes}} :
|Project Permissions|Users / Groups / Project Roles|
|*Administer Projects* (Ability to administer a project in JIRA) | Project Lead |

There is a leak with rights managements : 
In the project role actor management (and url like {{<base_url>}}/GroupRoleActorAction.jspa?projectRoleId={{<project role id>}}&projectId={{<project id>}}, groups name are linked to the group screen {{<base_url>}}/secure/admin/user/ViewGroup.jspa?name={{<groupe_name>}}
(*but only administrators can view groupe menmbers*).

So, jira display authentification request (cf screenshot) without explanations and dysplay it again after sucessfull authentification.
An history back browser action can leave this circle.
With Jira 4.3, message is a little bit more explicit.

The standart "rights violation" message error should be better.

Cheers

F.P

Go to a project page, e.g.

fields.description:
When the issue's description field is set as Wiki Style Renderer, depending of its contents, JIRA generates an invalid HTML code. (see picture1.jpg). And if a Notification scheme is set, the mail sent from JIRA makes Outlook 2007 crush. 

I've tested it in Outlook 2003 and Windows Live Mail and the problem has not occurred. I also have tried to send the same contents from an external mail to a mail account configured in Outlook 2007 and the problem has not happened.

The workaround is to set the description field has Default Text Renderer.

Bellow there's a contents as example:

{code}
Config:
FC100 TS<-->(Port5)OTN Flex MOTR(Port1)<---Working-->(Port4)OTN Flex MOTR(Port6)<--XGIG-THRU mode<---->FC100 TS
                               \                                /
                                (Port 3)<--Protection--> (Port3)  

----------------------+----+----------------------+-----------------------------
01/01  0x00100003     |--->| 0x04001003     08/05 |  0x03  0x00/00  0x0000
       ODU0: 1.0.0    |    | ODU0: 64.1.0         |
----------------------+----+----------------------+-----------------------------
{code}
fields.summary: Invalid HTML generated by Wiki Renderer

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an issue in project FOO (FOO-1)
2. Create another issue in project BAR (BAR-1)
3. From BAR-1 open the Create Subtask form in a new tab
4. Make sure you're on step 2 of the form but don't submit it (ie. the one with the summary and other fields - only occurs if more than 1 subtask issuetype)
5. In the original tab for BAR-1 move it to Project FOO (it should become FOO-2)
6. Return to your other open tab with the subtask form on it and submit it (it should be BAR-2)

You will now have an issue FOO-2 with Subtask BAR-2
fields.summary: Able to create subtask of an issue in another project

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an issue (ISSUE1)
2. Create another issue (ISSUE2)
3. From ISSUE2 open the Create Subtask form in a new tab
4. Make sure you're on step 2 of the form but don't submit it (ie. the one with the summary and other fields - only occurs if more than 1 subtask issuetype)
5. In the original tab for ISSUE2 convert it to a subtask of ISSUE1
6. Return to your other open tab with the subtask form on it, call it ISSUE3 and submit it.

You will now have ISSUE1 > ISSUE2 > ISSUE3 - they only ever display in pairs however.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24289].
  {panel}

Repro-

-Search for items
-You get a list of bugs that match the items
-Open an item
-Click Next to navigate through the items
-Now move an item to a different project
the next and previous buttons go away and you're required to rerun the search.  But if you're in the middle of a 500 item list, try finding where you left off.  This makes management/administration of bugs very difficult especially when trying to triage a large list of issues to determine in which project a bug will be fixed.

If you move a bug, then click Next,and then click Previous (so that you would be on the bug that you just moved, it should just skip that bug.
fields.summary: Moving bugs/features should still allow the Next and Previous links to work from the original list of search results and not require you to rerun the search

fields.description:
Steps to replicate (in JIRA 4.1.1):
# Create a new user (e.g. "a_tester")
# Add that user to jira-users and jira-developers groups
# Create a new issue (e.g. ABC-1)
# Add the user to any User Picker field (e.g. "Owner" in my JIRA instance) *AND* Multi User Picker field (e.g. "Multiple Owners" in my JIRA instance) on that issue
# Delete the user
# Go back to view the issue, refresh the browser page (notice it does not show up anymore in the UI in either field)
# Add a comment to the issue
# Check the logs. You will see this error: 
2011-04-07 15:37:52,078 http-8090-4 WARN jthurmann 937x25029x1 xiu70j 172.18.240.108 /secure/EditIssue.jspa [issue.customfields.impl.AbstractSingleFieldType] Issue ABC-1 has an invalid value 'a_tester' stored in the field 'Owner'. User 'a_tester' was not found in the system. 

Notice that the system doesn't complain about the Multi-User Picker field although the value is actually retained in both fields. It only complains about the User Picker field. 

Now, go back and recreate the user:
# Re-create user"a_tester"
# Go back to view issue ABC-1. Notice that the user is back in both Owner and Multiple Owners fields

I believe this is a bug. If you delete a user from the JIRA userbase, the values should be deleted from all fields. It should only be retained in the history tables.

Morever, not removing it causes WARN statements in the logs during Full Indexing.

2011-04-07 14:41:10,375 IssueIndexer:thread-10 INFO jthurmann 840x59x1 xiu70j 172.18.240.108 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [action.admin.index.IndexAdminImpl] Re-indexing is 62% complete. Current index: Issue

fields.summary: Username values not removed from User Picker and Multi User Picker fields after user is deleted in JIRA 4.1.1

fields.description:
That behavior occurs only when using Internet Explorer 9 and JIRA 4.3.1. Has been tested on a Vanilla instance.

You start to type and JIRA quickly suggest you the options. You click in one of that and wait to JIRA populate the field. Instead of that, nothing is added or replaced on the field and the exception "...is not a valid *<resource_name>*" is thrown.
Even activating the compatibility mode it doesn't work.
fields.summary: Autocomplete Feature Doesn't Populate the Fields on Internet Explorer 9

fields.description:
This behavior occurs only when using Internet Explorer 9 (no compatibility mode) and JIRA 4.3.1. Reproduced on a Vanilla instance.

When you roll mouse over the name of the Assignee or the Reporter (Default Issue View Screen) a box with him profile is showed. However, when you move the mouse out of that a black box appears in the place that it has been displayed.

*Steps to reproduce*:

# Open a ticket.
# Move the mouse over the name of Assignee or Reporter, at the right column.
# See a box with the user's profile info. Move the mouse cursors over. Only a black box remain.

*Workaround*:

* Enable the compatibility mode of IE9.
fields.summary: A Black Box Appearing When Mouse Cursor Runs Away of Assignee/Reporter Profile Info (Default Issue View Screen)

fields.description:
When attempting to assign a ticket to another user, I cannot seem to jump to the intended user in drop down menu by typing in the first few letters of their name.  Instead, if I type a few letters, the menu suddenly jumps to the top of the list and selects my own name.

This behaviour seems to be happening in both Safari 5 and Chrome 10, but not in Firefox 4 (all on OS X)
fields.summary: Cannot use keystroke to assign ticket to user

fields.description:
In bigger companies several business reasons exist that will force you to have more than one Jira instance running. Often there are dependencies between the different instances so a transfer of an existing isse from one instance to the other will be necessary to avoid duplicate work for the employees. This transfer should run on a scheduled base and as well synch changes to the orginal issue to the "cloned" one.

I see that I'm not the first asking for this and some requests seem to be from a long time ago. Most of them are asking for a possibility to link issues between different interfaces but this would be solved by my proposel as well.

Having in mind what the external import does already provide, the changes to it would be pretty small I guess. The mapping logic that lets you choose the destination issue type and the fields is already there. So the input should not come from an excel file but from a separate Jira instance. The selection for "what to be transported" could be a kind of "public" search for issue query for example (one the other instance). The new thing would be the making use of what you already provide + some kind of scheduling module which manages the query results (= jobs, more than one of course) and execute it scheduled (seperate settings per job). The direction would be always this one: have the job on the receiver side. A synchronization of the issue might as well be a complete transfer for example (if that saves you development time).

Please let me know what you think about this. Hoping for votes would be waste I guess (as I took a look into the number of open requests, so hard for customers to scan them all I would say).
fields.summary: Reuse / enhance "Import Data" to build a brigde between two seperate Jira instances (connect 2 jira instance by issue duplication)

fields.description:
*Step to reproduce*
# Install Firefox 4 in MAC OS 10.6.7
# Attach a screenshot via _More Action>Attach Screenshot_ in a issue screen.
# A pop up box from JAVA request user to update JAVA version to latest version using Sotfware Update feature.
# JAVA version is up to date for the moment this report filed (build 1.6.0_24-b07-334-10m3326), hence this function is not useable. 
# For more detail refer to the attached screenshot.
|

*Finding*
* Tested Firefox 4 in other OS ( WIN XP ), no problem reported.
* Tested with Firefox 3.6.x, no problem.
* Only happen specific to Firefox 4 in MAC OS.

*Workaround*
# Firefox 4 is currently not supported, please use Firefox 3.6.x or other supported browsers.

fields.description:
Currently, to access the Project Administration page, it is required to select the project first and then expand the "Administration" menu option on the top menu and select the name of the project in there.

To improve usability and consistency, this would be better to be moved as a tab within the project page where you can access the project summary, issues, road map, etc.

Since the link rendering feature have been removed from the Application link plugin, the *Display URL* field should also be removed from the plugin.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Editing+an+Application+Link

!application_link.png!

fields.description:
On http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Notification+Scheme it says:

"Issue Moved:	 An issue has been moved into this project."

That implies that when an issue is moved, it only sends notifications according to the notification scheme of the destination project, but in my testing it appears to use the notification scheme of the original project as well.
fields.summary: Documentation for notification schemes implies that "Issue Moved" only uses the notification scheme for the target project, but actually uses the source project, too

fields.description:
Please see: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-59420

I have reproduced this by running JIRA and Confluence on the same IP with no context path

If you give them different context paths (e.g. localhost:8080 vs. localhost:8090/jira) then this works fine

So a temporary workaround for now would be to give e.g. JIRA a /jira context path
fields.summary: When delegating user management in Confluence 3.5 to JIRA 4.3, the configuration fails if Confluence and JIRA share the same context path

fields.description:
*[This can be closed. I have found that it works fine in Jira 4.3.4]*

header.js needs to have a dependency declared on jira.webresources:jira-global

I have some Javascript in a plugin that I need to load after header.js loads.
I figured the clean way to do this was to declare a dependency on jira.webresources:header
like this

{code}
   <web-resource name="Create Issue Shortcut Disable Resources" key="create-issue-shortcut-disable-resource">
      <description>Static JavaScript that disables the Create Issue pop up</description>
      <dependency>jira.webresources:header</dependency>
      <resource name="disable-create-issue-shortcut.js" type="download" location="js/disable-create-issue-shortcut.js"/>
      <context>atl.general</context>
   </web-resource>
{code}

However doing this pushes header.js up in the HTML HEAD above namespace.js which leads to this error

{noformat}
jQuery.namespace is not a function
resources/jira.webresources:header/header.js
Line 576
{noformat}
fields.summary: header.js needs to have a dependency declared on jira.webresources:jira-global

fields.description:
The plugin manager in JIRA should check the consistency of the plugin downloaded. 

Indeed, I have encountered an  issue installing GreenHopper in JIRA, where the plugin installed could not be enabled: see [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-2230]. It seemed that the plugin downloaded was corrupted, due to an error during the file transfer. The problem was solved by downloading again the plugin manually. It would save time to have the plugin manager check consistency of the plugin downloaded.

Force fancybox in gallery to use 'image' type

fields.description:
We are currently migrating from 3.13.5 to 4.2.2

I was so happy about the existence of the new IssueService described here:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Issue+Operations

By now updating an Issue is a real pain:
- update issue, update customfields
- set the updateDate
- store changeInfos
- reindex
- fire event

So I thought: "Lets use the new IssueService. This thing will do everything for us..."

After spending some time in the docu and a lot more in the debugger I am frustrated.
IssueService.updateIssue does actual IssueService.editIssue...

I am missing:
- fire own Events
- update Fields that are not on the Edit Issue Screen
- update an Issue without having Edit(!)-Permission


Am I missing something, or is this intended?
fields.summary: IssueService.updateIssue does Edit Issue
Make UserService.FieldName public so that plugins using Peace Harmony can add field errors without hard-coding field names.

fields.description:
As you can see in the Screenshot attached, the project portlet is not working any more if there are projects with an invalid user as project lead.
Saving the portlet is only possible, if you manually select all other project without the one with the missing / wrong lead

May be related to JRA-11326

With kind regards,
~Marcel
fields.summary: Project Portlet / Gadget not working any more if there are Projects with an invalid project lead

fields.description:
Following up on the comments in JRA-22633, I think it's a mistake that the JIRA FishEye Plugin is considered a required plugin. This is not core functionality to JIRA and should be optional.

It has some known performance issues when there are large numbers of projects in JIRA and/or repos in FishEye that necessitate disabling it in those situations.
fields.summary: JIRA should not consider the JIRA FishEye Plugin to be required

fields.description:
In {{jira.webresources:global-static/jira.webresources:global-static.css}}, the {{.notify}} (amongst others) has a style {{background-color: #FF1493!important;}} which is overriding the  {{.notify.error}} style of {{background-color: #FFE7E7;}}. This results in an error that is actually not easy to read.

Suggest changing to the lighter color all around, or remove the !important.

"Mein eyes! Help me, Fallout Boy! Zees goggles, zay do nussing!"
fields.summary: Adjust CSS coloring of FishEye repository error notification

fields.description:
Need a complete dump of all Org level WLD IDs for US-based large and medium law firms.  The output should include Org WLD ID, Firm name, and related address information (city, state, zip code).  A text file that we can open in Excel or Access would be the desired output format.  A year ago we received a similar data dump, below is the select statement that was used to pull the information we were given.  

select *
from WLD.ORGANIZATION o, WLD.ADDRESS a, WLD.PROFILE p where O.ORG_WLD_ID = A.WLD_ID and o.ORG_profile_ID = A.profile_ID and O.ORG_WLD_ID = p.WLD_ID and o.ORG_profile_ID = p.profile_ID and O.ORG_VERSION_NUMBER = 1 and A.VERSION_NUMBER = 1 and p.VERSION_NUMBER = 1 and P.STATUS_CODE = 'A'

I have never opened a ticket like this before, so please contact me if I did anything wrong 
email:  michael.weber@thomsonreuters.com or phone 651-848-5743
fields.summary: Full Data dump of all Org WLD IDs for US-based large and medium law firms

fields.description:
If a project key contains a number, (eg. ABC2) then even though the project key is legal, the "Jump to an Issue" feature doesn't work (eg.  ABC2-11).

It used to work in 3.x and earlier versions.

It works fine for non-numeric keys.

The search facility also works when looking for *key=ABC2-11* or *key="ABC2-11"*

Note that although this is a minor misfeature, it is a major annoyance as far as the users affected are concerned.
fields.summary: "Jump to an Issue" doesn't work for project keys with numbers in them

fields.description:
Notification-Emails in HTML-Format include two references to CSS_stylesheets with the following URLs:
http://<server>/<context>/s/614/9/1.0/_/download/resources/jira.webresources:global-static/global.css
http://<server>/<context>/s/614/9/1.0/_/download/resources/jira.webresources:global-static/global-static.css

While the former works, the latter yields Apache-Error 404, file not found.

Inspecting atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\system-webresources-plugin.xml I found the working resource
<resource type="download" name="global.css" location="/styles/global.css" >
in web-resource <web-resource key="global-static" ...>, but did not find the other. 

(Maybe this is correct and it should deliver a combined CSS from all the resources under web-resource global-static?)

The source of the problem seems to be the velocity-file in 
atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/email/html/includes/header.vm.
fields.summary: HTML Emails link to global-static.css, which is not available

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24254].
  {panel}

Is there a way to change Linked Issue using Bulk Change operation?

Scenario: I have 10 issues linked to a Task and wanted to remove 5 issues and link it to another issue.
Is this possible using Bulk Change?

Thanks
Pallavi
fields.summary: Is there a way to change Linked Issue using Bulk Change operation?

fields.description:
When maximizing the Pie Chart gadget in IE, the statistic table final row and column information is not rendered properly. The bug only persists in IE browser (tested in IE6, IE7, and IE8) and not for other browser (Mozilla FireFox, Google Chrome). See below screenshot:
!scshot1.png!
fields.summary: Pie Chart gadget statistic table is not rendered properly in IE when maximizing the gadget

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Create few issues 
# In query box, insert JQL with exact date like below.
{code}
createdDate <= 2011-04-05
{code}
# The result will only shows issues before 2011-04-05 but doesn't include issues at the mentioned date. (refer showissuewith createddate 2011-4-05.PNG)
# Query with _createdDate <= 2011-04-06_ will show issues that created in 2011-04-05. (refer show issue with createddate 2011-04-06.PNG)
|
